alert.note: Alert for Colfax; Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 8:00PM MDT until June 16 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE COOKS PEAK BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL COLFAX AND NORTH CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES... At 800 PM MDT, Rainfall is starting to slowly decrease over the Cooks Peak Burn Scar, however between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen. This heavy rainfall over the wildfire burn scar will keep the threat for continued runoff and flash flooding with possible debris flows. HAZARD...Excessive rainfall over the Cooks Peak Burn Scar will impact Rivera Mesa into Sweetwater Creek. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and potential debris flows in and around the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. Debris flows can include large masses of water and loose soil, ash, soot and burned wildfire debris. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Miami. State Route 569. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 403 and 411. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks, streams and ditches in the Cooks Peak Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters, climb to safety. To report flooding, contact the National Weather Service office in Albuquerque at 1.888.386.7637 when you can do so safely.
